title: 50 Cent is producing a docuseries on Tekashi 6ix9ine and other celebs
text:
50 and Tekashi have had a strained relationship since the young rapper went to jail. (Picture: REX/PA)

50 Cent is producing a new docuseries covering celebs and their legal dramas, with rise and fall of Tekashi 6ix9ine set to be the feature story.

According to TMZ Fiddy’ scripted docuseries is called A Moment in Time and will have six to eight hour-long episodes dedicated to each subject.

The project will be produced through 50’s G-Unit Film Television company.

Apparently the 44-year-old, real name Curtis Jackson, will frame the Gummo rapper’s story around his brief but controversial career, his arrest and trial.

Fiddy confirmed the news with a post to his Instagram which he captioned: ‘A moment in time, is grade if you liked new edition or the Bobby brown story. You’re gonna love this Abdul williams is no joke you’ll will see.’

Tekashi is facing a minimum sentence of 47 years and maximum life imprisonment after being charged with nine federal counts, including racketeering, conspiracy, firearms offences and also drug trafficking.

The 23-year-old rapper, whose real name is Daniel Hernandez, was arrested in November 2018 and has since struck a plea deal to reduce his sentence by revealing other gang members of the Nine Trey Bloods.

Two of his ex fellow gang members have received guilty verdicts for charges of kidnapping, racketeering and assault but Tekashi himself has apparently turned down witness protection for a ‘life of fame’.

Well it seems his 15 minutes will last a little longer with this kind of interest because 50-Cent isn’t the only one keen to explore the Fefe rapper’s infamous life on screen.

Tekashi has more than made a name for himself (Picture: AFP)

Tekashi’s triumphs and tribulations will also be explored in an upcoming Snapchat documentary about his life, as part of a series called Vs The World.

Fiddy’s series will also focus on Snoop Dogg, music producer Scott Storch, former NBA player Rafer Alston and 50 himself.

Snoop’s episodes will likely focus on his murder trial, which happened at the same time he had the highest-selling hip-hop album in the country, Doggystyle.

Rafer’s tale is about his journey from streetball legend to the 2009 NBA Finals with the Orlando Magic.

Storch’s story highlights his dynamic career as one of music’s most high-profile producers.

Meanwhile, the 50 Cent-focused eps include the making of his album, The Massacre, and his beef with Jimmy Henchman.

As for what this means for 50 and Tekashi’s strained relationship, that remains a mystery.

Prior to his stint his jail, Fiddy referred to Tekashi as ‘his son’ but after the arrest the In Da Club rapper was adamant he didn’t want contact.

‘Don’t call me,’ he said.
